question: Natural resources are materials obtained from nature that help humans survive and develop.
Renewable resources cannot be naturally replaced over time.
Non-renewable resources take millions of years to form and can be exhausted if overused.
Forests do not contribute to oxygen production.
The Amazon Rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Deforestation is a process that increases the number of trees in a forest.
Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface.
All the water on Earth is drinkable and can be consumed directly.
Rivers, lakes, and groundwater are major sources of freshwater.
Hydropower is generated using coal as the primary source of energy.
Solar energy is an example of a renewable energy resource.
Wind energy is produced by burning fossil fuels.
Petroleum is a renewable source of energy.
Land is an essential natural resource used for agriculture, housing, and industries.
Soil erosion is beneficial for agriculture and helps plants grow faster.
Gold and silver are classified as mineral resources.
Bauxite is used to manufacture aluminum.
Coal and petroleum are the primary sources of renewable energy.
Iron is commonly used in construction and manufacturing.
Excessive mining can lead to deforestation and land degradation.
Deforestation helps prevent soil erosion and maintains land fertility.
Recycling can help conserve natural resources and reduce waste.
The Sundarbans forest is well-known for its mangrove trees and Royal Bengal Tigers.
The Black Forest in Germany is named because of its dark soil and desert-like conditions.
Water pollution is mainly caused by dumping chemicals and waste into water bodies.
Urbanization has no impact on land resources.
Excessive use of fertilizers in farming can lead to soil degradation.
Renewable resources such as solar and wind energy can never run out.
Geothermal energy is generated from the heat inside the Earth's surface.
Land pollution occurs when excessive waste and chemicals accumulate on land.
Groundwater is the water that is found deep under the Earth's surface.
Mining activities have no impact on the environment.
Fossil fuels are an unlimited source of energy and will never run out.
Agricultural land is mainly used for farming and growing crops.
Planting more trees can help reduce the effects of deforestation.
Plastic waste is biodegradable and does not harm the environment.
Climate change is caused by excessive use of fossil fuels and pollution.
Oceans and seas contain the majority of Earth's freshwater supply.
Using energy-efficient appliances can help conserve energy resources.
Reusing and recycling materials can help reduce environmental pollution.
Iron ore is commonly found in Jharkhand and Odisha in India.
Forest fires can occur naturally or due to human activities.
Overuse of groundwater can lead to water scarcity and depletion.
Hydropower plants generate electricity using sunlight.
Reforestation involves planting trees in areas where forests have been destroyed.
The Three Gorges Dam in China is a major producer of wind energy.
Urbanization often leads to loss of agricultural land and deforestation.
Soil pollution is caused by excessive use of chemicals, fertilizers, and pesticides.
Climate change has no effect on natural resources.
The conservation of natural resources is important for sustainable development.
